Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Lactea Urban’ offers a remarkably clean, mild flavor with subtle mineral notes and a hint of fresh greens. The texture is exceptionally tender - almost delicate - with none of the chewiness found in larger snail species. The meat is pale, nearly translucent when raw, cooking to a soft, yielding consistency. The shells are the standout feature: porcelain-white with a semi-translucent quality that gives them an ethereal, milky appearance.

2. The Delicate, Elegant Specialty This snail’s subtle flavor and tender texture make it ideal for applications where delicacy and presentation are paramount.

  • Raw Snail Crudo: The premier preparation - sliced paper-thin and served raw with high-quality olive oil, sea salt, and micro-herbs to highlight its natural delicacy.
  • Lightly Poached in Broth: Gently poached in a delicate vegetable or chicken broth, preserving their tender texture and mild flavor.
  • White Wine and Herb Steaming: Steamed briefly with white wine and fresh herbs, creating a light, aromatic dish where the snail’s subtlety can shine.
  • Salad and Canapé Garnish: Provides elegant, bite-sized morsels for composed salads or as a sophisticated topping for canapés.

3. The Harvest & Growth Cycle ‘Lactea Urban’ thrives in stable, moderate conditions and is particularly sensitive to water quality and diet, requiring clean greens and calcium sources. They grow at a steady, moderate pace. In a carefully maintained Haloponic™, a colony provides a refined yield of 100-150 pristine snails per month, reaching optimal delicacy and size of 2.5 cm in 9-11 weeks from hatching.
